desc:
Comedy of errors
 - Forgot the water treatments, so plain Newlands spring water it was.- Effectively a 90m mash as I got busy bottling Miss Macclesfield v1.1
 - Mash tun couldn't hold enough for one batch sparge, so did two.
 - Added the 20m hop addition at 60m, then took it out at 30m, then added it again with the 10m hop addition at 5m. Didn't seem to help the bitterness, was still hectic on going into primary.
 - Despite new values in BeerSmith the boild off was still more than expected, only got 21l into primary.- Forgot to throw in the sugar!

Then- Dry hopped after seven days in primary. Left a further 14 days in primary before bottling.

desc:
Baked 2kg pumpkin chunks at 170C until mostly sweet and soft. 
Squashed pumpkin with potatoe masher.After this was left with 1.3kg pumpkin pulp.
One third went in the mash, one third in at 60min, one third in at 1 min.All the trub from the pot got pitched into primary.
Substituted Robertson"Mixed Spice"for Allspice.
Bottled half as is, half with an additional charge of spices (same as the 1 min addition)

desc:
Authentic to the style in spirit:
 - fermented at ambient temps ~20C (heating only prevented it dropping below 16C)- fermented with whatever German lager yeast I could get my hands on
 - hopped with a locally grown descendant of Hallertau (S Aroma)Original colour and flavour probably came from the extreme decoction of poorly modified locally grown malts. Not a problem for me luckily.SA National Homebrew Champs 2017 entry: Oct 2017
Scored 31, failed to progress past the first round

desc:
1067 pre boil, 1080 postboil
Split the wort into 2 fermenters (11l each)Topped each up to 22l @ 1040.
Made 2l hop tea: 20min 3l boil, 15g Southern Passion at each of 30, 15, 0 min.Pitched WB06 into one fermenter
Added hop tea and pitched US05 into the other fermenter

desc:
Baked 2kg pumpkin chunks @ 170 until soft and sweet. Pulped with a potato masher. Remaining mass 1.2kg.
Half the pumpkin went into the mash, half into primary via end of the boil.Stuck mash sent efficiency to hell, corrected with DME.

Spice mix this time:1tsp Cinnamon
1tsp Nutmeg0.5tsp Ginger
0.5tsp Mixed Spice

desc:
Finalist SANHBC 2019.
Scored 45 in the first round.Scored 35 in the finals.

Eisbock from first runnings: into fermentor 20l @ 1.072- freeze concentrated on 7 July 2019: 
 - racked 18l @ 7.1% ABV to secondary- freeze concetrated down to 16l
 - est ABV 8.0%Second runnings into an Small Beer / Amber Ale:
 - pre boil: 25l @ 1029- 30 min boil
 - 35g African Queen @ 30min- 50g African Queen @ 0min
 - post boil OG: 20l @ 1034- Fermented with 11g US-05
 - bottled FG 18.5l @ 1010- ABV 3.9%

desc:
Did a partigyle, first running recorded in BeerSmith.

Second runnings:Added 500g Wheat Malt and 250g Light Crystal to the mash tun.
Sparged with 20l go-zone water untreated.Got 23l @ 1021.
Added 500g brown sugar for 23l @ 1030.Boiled 45 min
 - 15g Southern Aroma 2019 @ 45min- 30g Tettnanger (3.13%) @ 0min
Into the fermenter: 17l @ 1034. Est IBU 15Fermented 14 days with 1pk SafBrew Abbeye
Bottled 15l @ 1013FG. Est ABV 2.6%

NCP half:bottled 11L @ 1012 = 3.1% ABV

desc:
Made 3 batches:

First Runnings:Boiled down to 20L @ 1065. Hop additions recorded in BeerSmith.
Split in half, diluted one half down to 20L @ 1032Fermented each with 5.5g US05

British Strong Ale: 10L, OG 1065, FG 1022, ABV 5.7%Dark Mild: 20L, OG 1032, FG 1010, ABV 2.9%

Second Runnings:Boiled down to 15L @ 1029, 7g Southern Passion @ 30min
Fermented with NCP Instant Bread YeastSmall Beer: 14l, OG 1029, FG 1014, ABV 2.0%

name: test_allgrain

steps.name: Protein Rest
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Saccharification
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Mash Out
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Lauter
steps.description: Used for some authentic German styles.  Attempt to draw decoction from the thickest portion of the mash.  Profiles vary.  Some traditional German mashes use a long acid rest at 40 deg C.  Also some sources recommend the decoction amount be given a 15 minute saccharification rest at 158 F (70 C) before boiling it.

steps.name: Package
steps.description: Package the beer for aging and consumption
